alert.note: Alert for Broadwater; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Jefferson (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 12:47PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Thunderstorms Developing near and west of the Continental Divide will impact portions of southern Lewis and Clark, northwestern Broadwater and northern Jefferson Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 1244 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking developing thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles southwest of Wolf Creek to 18 miles north of Basin to 10 miles east of Galen. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Occasional lightning and brief rainfall are also possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Basin around 105 PM MDT. Wolf Creek around 110 PM MDT. Helena around 120 PM MDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Wickes, York, Rimini, Alhambra, Corbin, Spring Meadow Lake State Park, Austin, Elkhorn State Park, Marysville and Winston. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 138 and 241. Highway 200 between mile markers 67 and 95. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 4 , and between mile markers 29 and 80. Highway 287 between mile markers 1 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
